subject: Learning
title: Deep Work: The Rare Skill
description: Learn Deep Work: The Rare Skill in one minute.

hook.text: Cal Newport noticed that the most successful knowledge workers do something others can't: focus deeply for hours.

buildup.text: Deep work is cognitively demanding, distraction-free effort that produces high-quality output.

discovery.text: It's the opposite of shallow workâ€”email, meetings, and administrative tasks that feel busy but produce little.

twist.text: Most workers spend their days on shallow tasks and wonder why they never make progress on hard problems.

climax.text: Deep work is trainable. Like a muscle, the more you practice undistracted focus, the longer you can sustain it.

punchline.text: In a distracted world, deep focus is the new competitive edge.

quiz.question: What distinguishes deep work from shallow work?
